entry.title: Master Food Preserver workshop coming in February
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Oregon State University Extension Service has a Master Food Preserver Workshop happening from 12:30-4:30 p.m. Feb. 17 at Pine Grove Community Church on Buckhorn Road.

entry.title: Library to host cultural event
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Public Library will be hosting a Charreria program from 6:30 p.m.-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1. A Charreria is a the 500-year-old practice of horsemanship and roping, and became Mexico's national sport in 1933.

entry.title: RESCUERS RESPOND AFTER BOAT CAPSIZES NEAR ELK ISLAND
entry.summary: January 23, 2024 3:50 a.m. Rescuers from several agencies responded after a boat capsized near Elk Island in the South Umpqua River in Roseburg on Monday afternoon. An initial call for help came in around 2:40 p.m. Scanner reports indicated that three men were in boat when it turned over. The News Review reported that...

entry.title: SOUTH UMPQUA SCHOOL BOARD NAMES FINALISTS FOR NEXT SUPERINTENDENT
entry.summary: January 23, 2024 3:40 a.m. After completing a rigorous multi-state search, the South Umpqua School Board and screening advisory committee, consisting of school staff, parents, and community members, narrowed the diverse applicant pool to three finalists on January 19th. The finalists to be the next superintendent are: *Erika Bare: Bare is currently the assistant superintendent...

entry.title: REEDSPORT SEEKING CITY ATTORNEY
entry.summary: January 24, 2024 3:30 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport is seeking a city attorney. A City release said they are inviting proposals for contracted attorney service. For a list of duties and services required, go to the city’s website: www.cityofreedsport.org. Proposals are due to the city recorder’s office by 4:00 p.m....

entry.title: GEORGIA STILES PASSES AWAY AT AGE 91
entry.summary: January 22, 2024 3:40 a.m. Well known Roseburg resident Georgia Lee Hoover Stiles passed away on January 18th. Stiles and her former husband Bill, came to Roseburg in 1961. Stiles was well known for her many contributions to the community through both work and volunteering. She was one of the first women to join the...

entry.title: FEEDING UMPQUA RECEIVES SEMI-TRUCK OF FOOD FROM SHERM’S
entry.summary: January 22, 2023 3:10 a.m. On Friday, Feeding Umpqua received a semi-truck load of food from Wanda and Steve Olsrud, owners of Sherm’s Thunderbird Market. The annual donation began in 2006. Since then, Sherm’s has donated over 500,000 pounds of food to Feeding Umpqua, the regional food bank operated by the United Community Action Network. ...

entry.title: CELEBRATION OF LITERACY IN FEBRUARY
entry.summary: January 22, 2023 2:50 a.m. The Celebration of Literacy is a series of events happening between February 1st and March 1st. Presented by the Altrusa Club of Roseburg and the Umpqua Literacy Council, COL began in 2002, and is designed to provide a county-wide motivational reading program for students and families in the Umpqua Valley....

entry.title: Lambing school: Learning how to help ewes, lambs
entry.summary: Most ewes can deliver lambs with no problems, but sometimes they need human assistance, which is why a lambing school was offered Saturday to help people gain the skills necessary to help.

entry.title: Scholarship applications open for graduating seniors
entry.summary: Roseburg Education Association is awarding two $1,500 scholarships to two graduating seniors. The scholarship may be used to attend any accredited school of higher education or trade school, within the USA or its territories.

entry.title: Oregon nonfarm payroll employment increases
entry.summary: In December, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment rose by 3,900 jobs, following a revised loss of 5,900 jobs in November.

entry.title: Diving deeper into the library collection

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTH-CENTRAL OREGON CASCADES
entry.summary: January 20, 2023 6:00 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for the south-central Oregon Cascades above 5,500 feet from 10:00 a.m. Saturday to 4:00 a.m. Sunday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said wet snow is expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 10 inches, with higher elevations seeing up to 15 inches....

entry.title: Sutherlin Woodshop receives Operation Helping Heroes donation
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Sutherlin High School’s woodshop program received a donation of $1,500 from Country Financial agent JR Guthrie of Sutherlin, through the Operation Helping Heroes program.
